definition: to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
to check/to examine/to inspect/to exercise restraint
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: Can I check in here for the Air France flight to Paris?
sentences.chinese: 我乘法航班机飞往巴黎，能在这里检票吗？

sentences.english: The train conductor punched my ticket.
sentences.chinese: 火车检票员在我的车票上轧洞。

sentences.english: Just go through the ticket checker over there.
Has it been out of your possession at any time before checking-in?
sentences.chinese: 在检票前有有别人帮助保管？

sentences.english: Excuse me. What is the checking-in time here at the airport?
sentences.chinese: 请问，机场什么时候开始检票登机？

sentences.english: And the ticket inspectors who have low salaries .
sentences.chinese: 还有检票员，因为薪酬很低也榜上有名。

sentences.english: Travelers, please take note, the D76 train from Shanghai to Qingdao has begun checking tickets.
sentences.chinese: 你好，可以让我们先安检吗？我们的火车开始检票了。

sentences.english: He showed his ticket to the conductor and got on.
sentences.chinese: 他向检票员出示了车票，然后上了车。

sentences.english: Passengers are requested to show their tickets at the barrier.
sentences.chinese: 旅客需要在检票口出示车票。

sentences.english: Soon after the train was underway, the conductor walked through the car, checking tickets.
sentences.chinese: 火车开动后不久，列车员就到车厢里来检票了。

sentences.english: Here is the ticket-counter. Let's get the tickets punched.
sentences.chinese: 这是检票口，我们去检票吧。

sentences.english: Here is the ticket-counter. Let's get the tickets punched.
sentences.chinese: 这是检票口，我们去检票吧。

sentences.english: He went through the ticket barrier and found the station buffet .
sentences.chinese: 他急忙通过检票口，找到车站餐厅。

sentences.english: There were the smartly uniformed provodnitsas (train attendants) standing territorially by their carriage doors while they scrutinised tickets.
sentences.chinese: 穿着漂亮制服的列车员站在自己车厢门前检票。

sentences.english: Do I check in for the Train D404 to Shanghai here?
sentences.chinese: 到上海的D四零四次是在这儿检票吗？

sentences.english: Do I check in for the train D5 to Beijing here?
sentences.chinese: 去北京的D5次车是在这儿检票吗？

definition: to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
to bounce (a check)/to return a ticket/ticket refund
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
